lesson_title: Norwegian Keyboard Practice: Right Hand Home Row
chapter: Chapter 3: Right Hand Home Row Keys
objective: Familiarize yourself with the right hand home row keys, building muscle memory and accuracy.
warm_up: Before starting, ensure your right hand is correctly placed on the home row: Little finger on 'Æ', Ring finger on 'Ø', Middle finger on 'L', Index finger on 'K'. Your thumb should rest lightly on the space bar.

exercises.name: Exercise 1: Single Key Strokes
exercises.description: Focus on pressing each home row key on the right hand individually.

exercises.name: Exercise 2: Key Combinations
exercises.description: Press keys in varying sequences on the right hand.

exercises.name: Exercise 3: Word Practice
exercises.description: Type the following combinations using the right hand keys.

exercises.name: Exercise 4: Rapid Repetition
exercises.description: Type the following sequence rapidly using the right hand keys.
tasks: Løk Ølk Kål Løkk Ølkø Køl Løkkøl Ælkølk Ølkøl Kåløk Løkkål

feedback_and_tips.common_mistakes: Avoid tensing up your fingers. Keep them relaxed and use the appropriate finger for each key.

cool_down: After completing the exercises, stretch each finger individually. Pull gently back on each tip, ensuring you feel a light stretch but no pain. Hold each stretch for 5 seconds.
conclusion: Great job on completing the Right Hand Home Row exercises! Return to these exercises regularly.
